snippet: Though once widely reviled, Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani and his reputation as an economic pragmatist and modernizer seem to be resonating with the Iranian public.
abstract: Iran's former president Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani, who suffered humiliating defeat to Mahmoud Ahmadinejad in 2005 presidential election, is attempting a comeback, registering to run in upcoming election; though once widely reviled, his reputation as economic pragmatist and modernizer seems to be hitting responsive chord with Iranian public.
lead_paragraph: Though once widely reviled, Ali Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani and his reputation as an economic pragmatist and modernizer seem to be resonating with the Iranian public.

headline.seo: Ex-Iran President Seeks Comeback Against Odds
headline.main: Trying Unlikely Comeback, Ex-Iran President Strikes Chord With Public
headline.print_headline: Trying Unlikely Comeback, Ex-Iran President Strikes Chord With Public
